title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
hi,

There was fluid in the CB722 area CB722 was removed and the area was cleaned. it draws 0.05 amps right now and the U3900 is a bit hot. I couldn't find the part code of the u3900


f7000 = 12.68 voltage
R7020= 20 Voltage

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
U3900 is the T2 chip.

Is the machine detected in DFU mode?

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
1- The battery is full sign does not appear on the screen, while the battery is plugged in, the current drawn decreases to 0.30, 0.60, 0.77, 0.85 and 0.05 amps, and the same thing is repeated all the time. I'm noticing the u3900 is getting a little hot. Is it normal for the u3900 to get hot at 0.05 amps? This device is in contact with liquid. 
2-I haven't tried DFU mode because there is no battery charging message on the screen and it won't charge.

3-cb721 is not in place, does it prevent it from opening?

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
You should solder CB721 at the end, but doesn't prevent the board to boot.

If all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present, machine should enter DFU; if T2 is good.
To complete DFU, SSD voltages must be there too.

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message: I'm not sure if you tried DFU, or not yet...

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message: The device does not draw a constant current. In the continuous restart mode, the current rises to 0.85 and then drops to 0.05. Doesn't that indicate that the device is not turned on? In the video, it is seen that there is a battery sign, no battery sign is displayed on the screen. I tried DFU mode and it did not work.

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://disk.yandex.com.tr/i/P4_oYonTLcqaRQ[/URL]

current drops to 0 continuously

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
PPBUS_G3H is not stable?
AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages try to appear at least?

Try to understand, many times DFU fix boards not turning on.
T2 must turn on the board, when works properly.
Fixing T2 corrupted firmware, doesn't require the board to turn on; just need above mentioned voltages.

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message: PPBUS_G3H  CC764 = 11.11 Voltage and 12.34 Voltage not stable

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
3V3_G3H_RTC stable voltage (L6960/91)?
Also check if AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present, or pulse at least.

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
[U]L6960/61)[/U] = 3.3 Volt fixed
91 ? 61

Where else should I read the SLPS2R voltage?

C7909 = 1.8 Volt  PP1V8_SLPS2R
C7903 = 1.0 Volt PP1V1_SLPS2R
R8601 = 1.8 Volt PP0V9_SSD1
C8648 = 2.5 Volt  PP2V5_NAND_SSD1

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
Sorry, I meant L6960/61.
A lot of AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages on pages 75/76.

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
[U]L7811 [/U]- PP0V82_SLPDDR = 0.8 Voltage After 30 seconds, it drops to 0 voltage and returns to the same voltage. 
[U]L7813[/U]-  PP1V8_SLPS2R    = 1.8  Voltage After 30 seconds, it drops to 0 voltage and returns to the same voltage. 
[U]L7814[/U]-  PP1V1_SLPS2R    = 1.1  Voltage After 30 seconds, it drops to 0 voltage and returns to the same voltage. 
[U]L7816[/U]- PP0V9_SLPDDR    = 0.9  Voltage After 30 seconds, it drops to 0 voltage and returns to the same voltage. 

In the video I sent you, the current was falling to 0, at that moment all voltages go out and then it comes back.

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
Is R7020 voltage stable?
Even 5V there (but stable) is enough for U7000 to generate PPBUS_G3H.
You may need to resolder, or change U7000.

BTW, check without battery connected, only charger plugged in.

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
current draw only when the charger is plugged in 0.06 amps

Motherboard is on blank board only charger is plugged in.
all voltages are stable without battery R7020 stable 20 volts

L7811,L7813,L7814,L7816 voltages are stable with no battery installed

(no battery) Q7065 pin 5 voltage is not stable 12.24 volts then drops to 0 volts . is this normal ?

F7000/1 12.24 Volt stable

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
So you get stable SSD and SLPS2R voltages (no battery).
Check if AWAKE voltages are stable too.
If yes, then machine must appear in DFU.

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message: Check if AWAKE voltages ?

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
Where can I check the awake voltage?

Where can I check the awake voltage, by the way, RB305 is corroded and broken, I changed it, but the situation is the same.

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message: Take a look at page 75 & 76...

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
The device draws 0.22 amps at the first voltage, then drops to 0.05 amps. After about 1 minute, it drops to 0.0 amps and then returns to 0.05.

as if the device will turn on but there is a short circuit, so it won't turn on

PPVDDCPU_AWAKE = 0.7 voltage
PPVDDCPUSRAM_AWAKE = 0.8 Voltage
PP1V2_AWAKE = 1.1 Voltage
PP3V3_AWAKE =3.3 Voltage

title: 820-01700-A LIQUID CONTACT
message:
As you've found broken RB305, there may be other resistor corroded in other areas.
If all above mentioned voltages are stabke, machine must go into DFU.

If not, T2 has internal problem, or is affected by accumulated crap underneath.
Try again, and be sure to exactly follow all the steps from DFU tutorial.
